I am interested in hearing what you think about improvements.

Silly economy is silly
description: A simple enough concept, very solid economy, off the grid+simone+SanSan=Fast & Cheap scoring.

name: Whizzards Trash Heaven
description: Well, pretty much what the name says. The ideal would be to put Data leak Reversal before you are tagged, so you can go, Joshua->Account->4 trash.

description: Suffocation through viruses.

name: Jinteki Breaker-Kill
Jinteki 0219
Reina-1
Efficiency committee rush
description:
Here is the deck I used to win Lyon Regional in france (not exactly same deck but nearly) and store championship in paris on 15/02. My only loss was to Kate recurring parasites.

I used the exact same deck at another store and lost to Andromeda and Kit. Making honorable 3rd place.

In fact I lose if I cant score early Efficiency Comittee early and if opponent takes his time building money and is not kind enough to suffer Ichi/Grim/Roto subroutine.

Would someone have an idea of how to : - Win against Shaper that wont let you put anything in remote and will take money for a late game win (where all my ice become crap except Tollbooth) - Convert money to win. Ash is all star here but my remote are too porous to make runner affraid to come 2 times - have another ooomph ice than Tollbooth.

name: Reina - Current
Rookie's Kate's Toolbox - Cloak & Dagger, R&D lockdown, gene
description:
24/02/2014

Remarks :

New : Plascrete carapace rather than Plascrete, that helps free up a bit of influence for stuff like Ice Carver (helps Dagger versus 6 str ICE and lower costs in general) and one more Account Siphon. Also removal of Same Old Thing for one more Account Siphon.

Lots of money to run a "classic" breakers suite, however here I want to try out cloak + dagger to see how it goes. Update : Pretty well, but you need a +1 STR boost (Ice Carver or Personal Touch) to avoid getting annoyed by sentries such as Archer, Flare... That have 6 STR.

Also some R&D potential with Indexing + R&D interface, it's possible that having both is redundant. Update : They are sometimes redundant, but you can assure a R&D lock all the time with that setup.

Draw is done exclusively with Professionals Contacts, it can be interesting to change that to a event based draw, since the deck has a bunch of money already. Update : Professional Contacts is fine within that deck.

Finally, a netshield is around to help with the annoying Jinteki players I face sometimes, as Hosukai Grid + the base Identity gets aggravating.

Trash Corroder and win.

3rd place Gator Games Store Championship (4-1 Runner, 3-2 Corp)

name: Shaper teaching deck
description:
Shaper teaching deck (1 core set only)

I removed Magnum Opus: Running is the heart of the game, and beginner tend to overuse MO instead, doing nothing but to build a bank. As trace will not be used much by my weyland deck, I also removed rabbit hole. Using only one core set, I need 4 more cards out of faction to build a valid deck: +3 easy mark to compensate lose of MO, +1 emergency shutdown, as it may help a scared runner to finally launch a run.

name: Weyland teaching deck
description:
Weyland Teaching deck (1 core set only):

No scorched earth, no tracing ICE. Also remove cards beginner does not generally use such as agressive negociation or shipment from kaguya. Add closed account as a more firendly version of Scorched Earth.

name: Gabe Knight v0
Tower 4.0
description: Took this to store championship, feb 2014

name: Andy test
description: This deck is experimental, comment if you want. I will likely ignore it though. . .

name: Blackguard of the Red Queen
description:
A deck idea tossed around and tested by myself @AKAndersen and @PatFIzzle22.

I just really wanted to put Reina and Blackguard together. It's in the early testing stages still, so any ideas are appreciated.

This deck wants to force the corp to rez all the ice that we want them to rez, and at a premium price using Blackguard + Xanadu, Bishop, Reina ID. In the process you'll get a good look at their defenses and either make them spend money or know that they can't afford to rez. You shouldn't have to deal with too much surprise ice this way and you can make the corp rez ice on servers you don't want to run while simultaneously making them spend creds.

After some testing, it's clear that this deck wants to set up for an explosive turn every 3-4 turns. Get everything ready for a couple of turns, see what the corp is up to, and then hit them with a devastating turn when they can't afford it. The Blackguard strategy doesn't even have to be used every game and can be thrown in as a surprise if you don't draw it early. 3x Mr. Li to get you Blackguard + Expose cards.

Blackguard + Snitch combo with Xanadu + Rook = Sicknasty!

Although it hasn't happened, I dream of the game where I Blackguard an Archer and the corp is forced to sac a Project Atlas...oh baby.

Again, early testing still. Looking for feedback.

name: Rookie's Gabriel - Probably should be Andromeda
description:
24/02/2014

Since the previous iteration (my first deck since I started the game), there was a few changes :

  • Removed Snitch, as I don't feel I need it much anymore
  • More Account Siphons, Same Old Thing x2 are also in
  • One clone chip in the case my breakers get trashed, as it is a problem with Jinteki's damage and Power Shutdowns

At this point, what could be improved : - The breaker suite feels a bit basic to me, but it works - Dirty Laundry would be nice, but I have so many cards that start runs already it would be somewhat redundant - The Akamatsu Mem Chip could probably be replaced, but I like having enough memory around - Only one Clone Chip draw back cards from the heap if they get trashed - Armitage could become Daily Casts, not sure - I'd like to see some parasites around, but where (one less corroder, and the mem chip?)

To note that I'm keeping Crash Space rather than Plascrete here, as the utility money for removing tags seems goes well with Siphon Abuse, and I don't want to stay tagged (because local meta)

name: One man's death...
description:
...is insignificant to the shareholders.

Churn 'em out like there's no tomorrow! This deck scores The Cleaners or a 5-advanced Project Atlas on turn 3 or 4 incredibly consistently, which puts a lot of pressure on the runner. Draw some agendas and ETR ice, throw the ice up and furiously push agendas. Keep some money around in case a kill opportunity comes up.

name: 5th Place GRNDL
description:
Played in two events over the weekend. Got second to last with the original build, but second day with small changes made the top 8 cut (lost by agenda points). Big money for the traces on Sea Source and Caduceus/Shadow when appropriate. I'm leaning towards dropping Shadows altogether for one more Curtain Wall and Hadrians. The small size would frequently get me a super server with Curtain Wall (with Oversite AI), Curtain Wall, and Hadrians.

I considered taking it to 49 with 3x Interns (for Refinery or Oversited Ice) and another GRNDL Refinery too. Still needs more testing to get it into that final cut!

name: Huge Bioroids v2
description: Played Version 1 at a local Seattle tournament and had trouble getting agendas out of my hand. The deck held up well in the early game until rigs were able to blow up the oversights. Added some more ETR ice and san sans.

name: world is mine
description: super fast rush. power down datasuckers. grim anything away that may break your ETR ice. rsvp is great to protect sansan/jackson or later in front of pop up if game is close and u need to shut down access to some centrals. u may want to flash some scorch before the game while taking deck from the box for additional advantage :)

name: HB Faster Stronger v2
description:
1) Install cheap ICE

2) Gain credits with operations

3) ???

4) Profit!

With this deck you can easily score a Gila Hands Arcology on turn 2, giving you an economic engine for the rest of the game, or accumulate credits with Melange Mining Corp behind a Wraparound.

The Biotic Labors can end the match after rushing out the first 3 agendas.

name: Whizzard Chess Master Gamer
description: Chess by the master gamer. Tough as hell to keep out. Deja for siphon, caissa pieces that go missing (bishop/knight). Tight on MU for keyhole...might drop for medium.

name: Rielle - fast pressure
Omega Kit
description:
This is my flavor of a kit deck. I understand that SMC, Clone Chip, PW, and Modded have no synergy with each other, so you have to be careful where you commit your programs for install. Lockpicks work wonders with cyber-cypher, and the Toolbox is there if you can manage to get it installed for more cheap runs.

Kit with Omega is stupidly strong. The presence of this card is only going to make her stronger than she has been.

The idea is to use cyber cyphers on servers to threaten everything, then after they have double iced every server, put in omega and run weak servers until they all have 3 ice. Parasite whatever you feel like.

name: WhizAIrd
description:
Use Parasites/DataSucker to keep the corps ICE count low. Use Knights to get through the first and maybe second layer on Server; and use Omega to get through the last on every server. Resource based econ, and Medium/Keyhole as a win condition, Nerve Agent for those special times. Stimhack for those turns where the corp thinks you can't make it past that last tollbooth.

Thinking about throwing in Demo Run, as it is remarkably powerful if you can start a turn with 2 Medium Counters.

name: CIIF
Noise 1
